title: ISldWorks.AddMenu
description: Adds a menu item to a SOLIDWORKS menu for DLL applications.
signature:
System.Int32 AddMenu( 
   System.Int32
DocType
,
   System.String
Menu
,
   System.Int32
Position
)

parameters.name: DocType
parameters.description: Document type to add the menu item as defined by swDocumentTypes_e

parameters.name: Menu
parameters.description: Name of menu item to add, including any parent menu names, e.g., subMenuString@menuString

parameters.name: Position
parameters.description: Specifies the position where to add the new menu item; 0 = first position and 1 = end of the parent menu (see Remarks )

returns: 1 if menu item is added successfully added or 0 if adding the menu item failed
remarks:
If the name of a parent menu is not specified in Menu, then:
the menu item appears on the
Tools
menu below the
XPress products
menu item.
Position is ignored.
Menus items are automatically created at the end of the parent menu when using
ISldWorks::AddMenuItem5
. Therefore, if your menu structure is created using sequential calls to SldWorks::AddMenuItem5, then all the menu items are positioned based on their order of creation.
This method is only required when a menu needs to be placed into an existing menu at a specific position.

Add-in Shortcut Menus
